item.title: Junior Governance and Home Affairs/Legal Expert (cat. III)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
The main objective of this assignment is to prepare a draft Law on the Transnistrian settlement process that would provide the legal basis for the existing and future interaction between the representatives of the two banks of the Nistru river. This would include the “5+2” talks, the expert Working Groups, and other forms of interaction between the officials of the Republic of Moldova and the de facto Transnistrian authorities at all levels.

The specific objectives are:

  • To define the status of the settlement process in the legal system of the Republic of Moldova;
  • To define the legal status of the agreements reached between Chisinau and Tiraspol in the framework of the settlement process.
  • To define the enforcement mechanisms of these decisions.
  • To foresee concrete legal powers of the Political Representatives of the Sides and the working groups.

Junior Governance and Home Affairs/Legal Expert (cat. III)

  • At least 3 years of work experience in public administration.
  • Experience in conflict resolution and/ or post conflict management would be an asset;
  • Master’s degree in Political Science, Law or any of the social sciences;
  • Experience in drafting of legislation;
  • Proven experience of working with various levels of government and/or international organization;
  • Previous experience in the conflict settlement process would be an advantage;
  • Excellent written and spoken English and Russian are required.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to nicte_garcia-soria@dai.com

item.title: Agricultural Development Project Expert (Cat. II)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
The global objective of the assignment is to ensure an appropriate integration of environmental and climate change concerns in the implementation of the 11th EDF Agriculture Focal Sector (called Programme hereafter).

The specific objectives are:

  • To describe, identify and assess the likely significant effects on the environment of implementing the 11th EDF – Agriculture focal sector and the projects under preparation, as well as the most important environmental and natural resource related constraints bearing on the implementation of this Programme.
  • To provide decision-makers of the Government of Swaziland and the EU with relevant information (quantitative and qualitative) to identify and assess the adequacy of environmental management and climate change adaptation measures in the Programme and the projects under preparation.
  • Provide concrete recommendations on mitigation or adaptation measures to be integrated in the Programme and projects under preparation so that potential negative effects can be minimized and positive effects can be optimized.

Agricultural Development Project Expert (Cat. II)

  • Master level or post-graduate studies in relevant field (e.g. environmental sciences, environmental economics, climate change sciences, agricultural sciences) or equivalent professional experience of at least 10 years in the same relevant fields;
  • Proven experience in the preparation and implementation of agricultural development projects: at least 2 assignments in total for each: preparation and implementation;
  • Proven experience in developing and conducting SEAs AND other types of environmental assessment (at least 1 SEA and 3 assignments in total);
  • At least one of these assignments as a team leader;
  • At least two of these assignments in the horticulture or livestock or water harvesting / irrigation sub-sectors;
  • At least one of these assignments in a temperate to semi-arid country with land scarcity and water harvesting issues;
  • Experience in countries AND sectors with both a modern and traditional governance.

The main objectives of the evaluation are to provide the relevant external co-operation services of the European Union, the partner governments and, when appropriate, the wider public with:

  • an overall independent assessment of the past performance of the intervention, of the programme “Support to trade development in Southern Mediterranean through the Agadir Agreement – Phase III”, (ENPI/2013/325-422), paying particularly attention to the results of the project against its objectives; although focus of the evaluation is on phase III, the action should be considered in perspective since the start of the ATU in 2007 and against the policy context of AGADIR economic integration. In particular, assess impact of EU support over three phases.
  • key lessons that the EC should take into account (achievements, weaknesses, open issues) and recommendations in order to improve current action – as well as recommendations for the way forward for a possible new EU support programme; identification of preconditions for future support.
  • recommendations on future sustainability of the ATU and the need to increase the share of the financing originating from the Agadir Agreement’s Member States’.

Location visits: Belgium, Jordan, Egypt, Tunisia, Morocco

Senior Expert in Policy Support/Regional Integration/Trade/PSD with Evaluation Experience (TL)

  • University degree preferably in economics, business, international trade, political science or equivalent;
  • extensive and relevant experience (minimum 10 years) in the project main objectives, including in evaluation of projects;
  • fully proficient in English and fair working level of French, as well as excellent report writing skills;

  • sound level of knowledge and experience in the South Mediterranean under the following relevant themes: o Policy Support and institutional Strengthening, o Regional Integration, o International Trade Agreements, o Private sector development;

  • fully conversant with the principles and working methods of project cycle management and EC aid delivery methods.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to nicte_garcia-soria@dai.com
